# Comserv Application

## Overview
Comserv is a comprehensive Catalyst-based web application for managing various aspects of business operations, including project management, documentation, and site administration.

## Key Features
- Project Management System
- Documentation System
- Todo Management
- Site Administration
- User Management
- Theme System

## Documentation
All documentation is located in the `Comserv/root/Documentation` directory. The documentation is accessible through the application's Documentation controller.

For developers and administrators, please refer to the documentation within the application for:
- Project Management System
- Documentation System
- Theme System
- Controller and Model documentation
- Installation and configuration guides

## Recent Updates
- Fixed project creation issue where 'group_of_poster' was being set to null
- Improved error handling and logging throughout the application
- Enhanced theme system with better organization and customization options

## Getting Started
1. Clone the repository

3. Configure your database settings in `db_config.json` (see Documentation/general/database_connection.md for details)
4. Start the application with `perl Comserv/script/comserv_server.pl`

## Development Guidelines
- All documentation should be placed in the `Comserv/root/Documentation` directory
- Use .tt template files for documentation rather than .md files
- All CSS should be part of the theme system (located in `Comserv/root/static/css/themes/`)
- Follow the existing file structure and naming conventions
- Use the scripts in the `Comserv/script` directory for common development tasks

## Important Notes for Developers
- When working with documentation, prefer .tt files over .md files
- When both .tt and .md files exist for the same content, merge the content into the .tt file and remove the .md file
- Always check for existing files before creating new ones to avoid duplication
- All CSS should be managed through the theme system rather than in individual files

- Project Management System
- Documentation System

- Use .tt template files for documentation rather than .md files

- Use the scripts in the `Comserv/script` directory for common development tasks

- Always check for existing files before creating new ones to avoid duplication
- All CSS should be managed through the theme system rather than in individual files

--- Comserv/root/Documentation/changelog/2025-10-15-documentation-access-fixes.tt +++ Comserv/root/Documentation/changelog/2025-10-15-documentation-access-fixes.tt @@ -0,0 +1,119 @@ +[% META + title = "Documentation Access and Display Fixes" + description = "Fixes for documentation access control and display issues" + roles = "normal,editor,admin,developer" + category = "changelog" +%] + +
+

Documentation Access and Display Fixes

+ +
+

Overview

+

+ This update addresses several issues with the documentation system, focusing on role-based access control, + path resolution, and template rendering. These improvements ensure that all users can access the documentation + they are authorized to view, with proper formatting and navigation. +

+

+ Date: October 15, 2025
+ Type: Bug Fix
+ Priority: High +

+
+ +
+

Issues Fixed

+ +

Role-Based Access Control

+
    +
  • Fixed issue where normal users couldn't access documentation marked for their role
    • +
  • Improved role detection logic to properly handle multiple user roles
    • +
  • Enhanced special case handling for 'normal' role to ensure any authenticated user can access content
    • +
  • Added detailed logging to help diagnose access control problems
    • +
+ +

Path Resolution

+
    +
  • Added support for default paths defined in documentation_config.json
    • +
  • Implemented a multi-stage path resolution process to find documentation files
    • +
  • Fixed "page not found" errors for valid documentation pages
    • +
  • Improved handling of different file types (.md, .tt, etc.)
    • +
+ +

Template Rendering

+
    +
  • Created a standardized markdown_viewer.tt template for rendering markdown content
    • +
  • Improved error handling with a dedicated error.tt template
    • +
  • Enhanced display of documentation metadata (last updated, roles, etc.)
    • +
  • Fixed styling inconsistencies across different documentation types
    • +
+
+ +
+

Technical Changes

+ +

Controller Updates

+ 
+# Enhanced role-based access control logic
+if (lc($role) eq lc($user_role)) {
+    $has_role = 1;
+    $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'debug', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'view',
+        "Role match: user role $user_role matches required role $role for page $page");
+    last;
+}
+# Special case for normal role - any authenticated user can access normal content
+elsif (lc($role) eq 'normal' && $user_role) {
+    $has_role = 1;
+    $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'debug', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'view',
+        "Normal role access granted to page $page for user with role $user_role");
+    last;
+}
+
+ +

Path Resolution Logic

+ 
+# Check if there's a default path defined in the documentation_config.json file
+if ($config->{default_paths} && $config->{default_paths}{$page}) {
+    $default_path = $config->{default_paths}{$page};
+    $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'view',
+        "Found default path for $page: $default_path");
+}
+
+# If a default path is defined, try to use it
+if ($default_path) {
+    my $full_default_path = $c->path_to('root', $default_path);
+    
+    if (-e $full_default_path) {
+        $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'view',
+            "Using default path for $page: $default_path");
+            
+        # Determine file type based on extension and render appropriately
+        # ...
+    }
+}
+
+
+ +
+

User Impact

+

+ These changes improve the documentation system in the following ways: +

+
    +
  • Normal users can now access all documentation intended for them
    • +
  • Documentation pages are properly rendered with consistent styling
    • +
  • Error messages are more informative and helpful
    • +
  • Navigation between documentation pages is more reliable
    • +
  • Role-based access control works correctly for all user types
    • +
+
+ +
+

Related Documentation

+
    +
  • Documentation Migration to Template Toolkit

  • Documentation Template Toolkit Template

+

Account Management Guide

+ +
+

Version: 1.1

+

Last Updated: October 15, 2025

+

Author: User Support Team

+
+ +
+

Overview

+

+ This guide will help you manage your Comserv account, including how to log in, log out, + update your profile information, and change your account settings. +

+
+ +
+

Logging In

+
    +
  1. Click on the "Login" link in the top navigation bar
    2. +
  2. Enter your username and password
    3. +
  3. Click the "Login" button
    4. +
+

+ If you've forgotten your password, click the "Forgot Password" link on the login page to reset it. +

+
+ +
+

Logging Out

+

To securely end your session:

+
    +
  1. Click on your username in the top navigation bar
    2. +
  2. Select "Logout" from the dropdown menu
    3. +
+

+ Important: Always log out when using a shared or public computer to protect your account. +

+
+ +
+

Viewing Your Profile

+

Your profile contains your personal information and account details:

+
    +
  1. Click on your username in the top navigation bar
    2. +
  2. Select "My Profile" from the dropdown menu
    3. +
+

The profile page displays:

+
    +
  • Your name and username
    • +
  • Email address
    • +
  • Account roles and permissions
    • +
  • Recent activity (if enabled)
    • +
+
+ +
+

Managing Account Settings

+ +

Accessing Settings

+
    +
  1. Click on your username in the top navigation bar
    2. +
  2. Select "Account Settings" from the dropdown menu
    3. +
+ +

Updating Personal Information

+

To update your name or email address:

+
    +
  1. Go to Account Settings
    2. +
  2. In the "Personal Information" section, modify the relevant fields
    3. +
  3. Click "Save Changes"
    4. +
+ +

Changing Your Password

+

For security reasons, you should change your password periodically:

+
    +
  1. Go to Account Settings
    2. +
  2. Click "Change Password" in the Danger Zone section
    3. +
  3. Enter your current password
    4. +
  4. Enter and confirm your new password
    5. +
  5. Click "Update Password"
    6. +
+

Password requirements:

+
    +
  • Minimum 8 characters
    • +
  • At least one uppercase letter
    • +
  • At least one number
    • +
  • At least one special character
    • +
+ +

Appearance Preferences

+

Customize your experience with theme settings:

+
    +
  1. Go to Account Settings
    2. +
  2. In the "Preferences" section, select your preferred theme
    3. +
  3. Click "Save Changes"
    4. +
+

Available themes:

+
    +
  • Default
    • +
  • Dark
    • +
  • Light
    • +
+ +

Notification Preferences

+

Control how and when you receive notifications:

+
    +
  1. Go to Account Settings
    2. +
  2. In the "Preferences" section, toggle "Receive email notifications"
    3. +
  3. Click "Save Changes"
    4. +
+
+ +
+

Account Security Best Practices

+
    +
  1. Strong Passwords: Use unique, complex passwords
    2. +
  2. Regular Updates: Change your password every 3-6 months
    3. +
  3. Secure Access: Avoid logging in from public or unsecured networks
    4. +
  4. Session Management: Always log out when finished
    5. +
  5. Email Verification: Keep your email address current for account recovery
    6. +
+
+ +
+

Troubleshooting

+ +

Login Issues

+

If you cannot log in:

+
    +
  1. Verify you're using the correct username and password
    2. +
  2. Check if Caps Lock is enabled
    3. +
  3. Clear your browser cookies and cache
    4. +
  4. Try using a different browser
    5. +
  5. Contact support if problems persist
    6. +
+ +

Profile Update Problems

+

If you encounter errors when updating your profile:

+
    +
  1. Ensure all required fields are completed
    2. +
  2. Verify your email address is in the correct format
    3. +
  3. Check that your password meets all requirements
    4. +
  4. Try again after a few minutes
    5. +
+
+ +
+

Getting Help

+

If you need assistance with your account:

+
    +
  1. Check the FAQ section for common questions
    2. +
  2. Click the "Help" link in the footer
    3. +
  3. Contact support at support@comserv.example.com
    4. +
  4. Use the live chat feature during business hours
    5. +
+
+ +
+

Privacy Information

+

We take your privacy seriously:

+
    +
  • Your personal information is stored securely
    • +
  • Passwords are encrypted and never stored in plain text
    • +
  • We do not share your information with third parties
    • +
  • You can request a copy of your data at any time
    • +
+

For more details, please review our Privacy Policy.

+
+

   - Added a comprehensive index.tt template for the Documentation controller

   - The documentation_config.json file properly maps all documentation files

3. The migration from .md to .tt files is well-documented

5. The documentation system is more robust and user-friendly

The system now properly handles both .md and .tt files, with a clear path for migrating all content to .tt files over time.
